text: The Jewish Quarterly is an international Jewish publication founded by Jacob Sonntag in 1953. It was based in the United Kingdom (UK) until 2021, when its ownership is transferred to Australian publisher Morry Schwartz, who was born to Holocaust survivors. With four issues released a year, The Jewish Quarterly focuses on issues of Jewish concern, but also has interests in wider culture and politics. ==Profile== The current editor is Jonathan Pearlman, who also edits Australian Foreign Affairs for Schwartz Media. Previous editors include Matthew Reisz, Elena Lappin and Rachel Shabi. ==Reception== In 1974, Sonntag described The Jewish Quarterly: ==Footnotes== ==References== Category:Publications Category:Jewish culture
title: The Jewish Quarterly
